proposal: auto-colony-spawn (autonomous colony spawning on frontier saturation)

expectation_expert.reason: Outcome not well-specified. No operational saturation definition, no controlled comparison, zero prior evidence.

findings: Runaway colony creation: no rate limiter, saturation can oscillate
Resource exhaustion: F-SP2 throughput ceiling means more colonies = dilution not growth

genesis_expert.reason: Spawn protocol has no auto-trigger mechanism (untested path). Atom auto-selection not ready (L-666 confound).

opinions_expert.reason: Interesting direction, premature execution. Contradicts L-629 (constant throughput regardless of N).

finding: All three council decision paths (CONDITIONAL, APPROVE, BLOCK) now tested. Council correctly distinguishes proposal quality: well-specified proposals with evidence pass (0.89 score), under-specified proposals without evidence fail (0.33 score). BLOCK criteria function as designed â€” untested spawn paths, unmitigated severity-1 failures, and low specificity all independently trigger BLOCK.
cross_domain_isomorphism: ISO: Council coverage = test coverage. Just as code needs all branches tested (happy path + error path + edge case), governance needs all decision branches tested (APPROVE + CONDITIONAL + BLOCK). The coverage gap was invisible until explicitly tracked. Same pattern as F-META8 contract validation: gaps persist until each path is exercised at least once.
